Good morning and welcome to the Black Mesa Transit System. This automated train is provided for the security and convenience of the Black Mesa Research Facility personnel. The time is 08:47 AM. Current topside temperature is 93 degrees, with an estimated high of one hundred and five. The Black Mesa compound is maintained at a pleasant 68 degrees at all times. This train is inbound from Level 3 Dormitories to Sector C Test Labs and Control Facilities. If your intended destination is a high-security area beyond Sector C, you will need to return to the Central Transit Hub in Area 9 and board a high security train. If you have not yet submitted your identity to the retinal clearance system, you must report to Black Mesa Personnel for processing before you will be permitted into the high security branch of the transit system. Due to the high toxicity of material routinely handled in the Black Mesa compound, no smoking, eating, or drinking are permitted within the Black Mesa Transit System. Please keep your limbs inside the train at all times. Do not attempt to open the doors until the train has come to a complete halt at the station platform. In the event of an emergency, passengers are to remain seated and await further instruction. If it is necessary to exit the train, disabled personnel should be evacuated first. Please stay away from electrified rails, and proceed to an emergency station until assistance arrives. A reminder that the Black Mesa Hazard Course decathlon will commence this evening at nineteen hundred hours in the Level 3 Facility. The semifinals for high-security personnel will be announced in a separate Secure Access transmission. Remember, more lives than your own may depend on your fitness. Do you have a friend or relative who would make a valuable addition to the Black Mesa team? Immediate openings are available in the areas of Materials Handling and Low-Clearance Security. Please contact Black Mesa Personnel for further information. If you have an associate with a background in the areas of theoretical physics, biotechnology or other high tech disciplines, please contact our Civilian Recruitment Division. The Black Mesa Research Facility is an equal opportunity employer. A reminder to all Black Mesa Personnel: Regular radiation and biohazard screenings are a requirement of continued employment in the Black Mesa Research Facility. Missing a scheduled urinalysis or radiation check-up is grounds for immediate termination. If you feel you have been exposed to radioactive or other hazardous materials in the course of your duties, contact your Radiation Safety Officer immediately. Work safe, work smart. Your future depends on it. Now arriving at Sector C Test Labs and Control Facilities. Please stand back from the automated door and wait for the security officer to verify your identity. Before exiting the train, be sure to check your area for personal belongings. Thank you and have a very safe and productive day.

You're all going to hate me for this. I really didn't like this game. In-fact, I hate this game. I really didn't enjoy playing this. I've heard for ages about people raving about 'half-life 3' and 'is it ever coming?', so I figured I'd actually play half-life and see what all the fuss was about. So far, I'm struggling to see it. First impressions haven't been good. I imagine (and from what I've heard) this game was good at it's time. Unfortunately, this doesn't hold up for me. Almost makes me feel bad that I was given a badge for buying a really old game during a steam  sale because 'it's old but I thought it was cool'. Clearly not. I'd probably think differently if this wasn't my first experience with half-life. But it was. I'm filled with regret, but also not.

Instead of just whining; here are my problems. Plus more whining. This game is so frustrating to play. It's like you're walking on ice or something. Gordan just slips around everywhere, you can't get to just take normal steps. The 'unique jumping' is so inconsistent. I could do the same jump five times and the fifth is the one time it works. The weapon select was so annoying. Even when I figured an easier way to use it, it was still so clunky and difficult to get the weapon I wanted. Something else that got frustrating was having no idea what the game wanted me to do. No clear objective or instruction annoyed me to no end. Even in the final level: what...do...I...do?! And why does it take fifteen bullets of an assault rifle to kill someone but only five of a pistol when they use the same ammunition? Just one of the many peeves I have of this game. Something that really got me; in the final levels with those weird jump-pads. My gosh, are they inconsistent. More specifically, in the final level. Why...to all of this?! I don't even know how many times I died or lost most of my health when those darn things didn't quite reach any target I aimed for on the way up or down (after failing up) and crashing against hard ground, despite the wonky gravity (and don't even get me started on the teleporter in that level). And I find it really funny when they mentioned in the end "anti-climactic". When they mentioned those words, I said out loud "This game is anti-climactic". That's how fed-up I was. So yes, I did finish it. Despite it's many problems, I was sad enough that I was willing to push through just to find out how it ended. Maybe that was a mistake. I'm not even sure if my game was glithing or not but after the credits my hud was still on and I had a black screen. All know, is a noise happens when I hit spacebar to jump. Maybe that's supposed to happen. Even after the credit music stopped. And still nothing happens. I have a bad feeling about the other half-life games. I almost wouldn't bother trying them, but I bought more in a steam sale along with this one. This game defiantly hasn't hooked me into the story. In-fact, I'd say it's steered me away from it. I'll still at least try the others I have but my expectations have dropped, thanks to this. It's probably worth mentioning that I didn't loathe everything about this game. There were some aspects I thought were pretty cool. Unfortunately, they were overshadowed by the things I didn't like. Oh yeah, and I only looked up a walkthrough for just one thing. That bloody room of teleporters. And the worst part? I strolled past the end to that part and I didn't even realize until I watched the walkthrough. I was so annoyed but at that point: that's just the normal feeling for this game. Personally; it sucked.

Half Life...  99 yılında bomba gibi düşen oyun dünyasında çığır yaratan oyun. Valve'ın belki de Steam'den sonra en iyi atılımı. 

Hikaye

Oyuna Gordon Freeman isimli bir fizikçinin sabah trenle Black Mesa araştırma tesisine gitmesiyle başlıyoruz. O gün ne olduğu nerden geldiği bilinmeyen G-Man isimli birinin Black Mesa'e Xen adlı gezegenden getirmiş olduğu  kristali araştırmamız söylendi. Fakat bir şeylerin ters gittiği hep belliydi ve araştırma yaptığımız anda kaza ile Dünya ve Xen arasında portal açıldı. 
Karakterimiz HEV adlı koruma giysisi sayesinde kurtulsa dahi yaşayacağı bir takım sıkıntılar kaçınılmazdı. 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Oynanış

- Her ne kadar çizgisel olarak ilerlense de  oyunda size farklı bulmacalar sunarak bu çizgiselliği -sıkıcı hale getirmiyor. 
- Ara sahne hiç yok hatta bunun için sinematik modlar ekleniyor. 
- Silah Kombinasyonları fazla ve vuruş hissiyatı çok güzel özellikle Revolver'ın.
- Oyunda müthiş bir gizem var ve bu da sizi oyunda teori kurmanıza ve hikayeyi merakla devam ettirmenize olanak sağlıyor.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Half Life 1'in fan remake'i olan Black mesa'ı oynamanızı tavsiye ederim. Günümüz grafikleriyle Half life tecrübesi yaşamak gerçekten muazzam bir olay. Büyük çaplı bir firma olmamalarına rağmen bu kadar güzel bir remake yapıp half life' ı daha üste taşımaları cabası.
Umuyoruz ki Valve'ın para hırsı Half life'a yatırım yapmalarının önüne geçmez de fan remakel ere ihtiyaç duymayız ve en yakında zaman da Half Life 3'ü görürüz.

The game that practically defined FPS, Valve’s first game “Half-Life” is way ahead of its time with its 3D graphics (thanks to the Goldsrc Engine), classic story, characters, gameplay and monumental sound design that still hold up today, even 20 years after its initial release.

It's Half-Life.
ХАЛФ ЛАЙФ ОДНИМ СЛОВОМ

First played it years ago and just played it again in 2018 and it's still one of the most well crafted first person shooters ever made. From the first minutes of the opening one can tell this is not just a Doom or Quake clone. Getting a tour of the Black Mesa facility aboard a tram and witnessing Gordan Freeman's first day on the job as a physicist is a treat. The narrative is seamless and engrossing and the atmosphere is oozing from every corner as horrific creatures from a different world populate the labrinthian facility. 

The gameplay itself is very versatile and responsive. The gunplay is quick and snappy, and the crowbar is fun to wack around. This is a shooter with platforming, puzzles, and exploration (I wish more shooters incorporated these elements!)

Simply put, Half-Life and its sequel are some of the greatest games ever made and never cease to entertain me and engross me in their world.

[quote=Setna] Başlamadan önce diğer incelemelerimi görebilmek için [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/36579661-Setna/] buraya[/url] tıklayın. [/quote]

Half-Life nasıl desem, artık bir genel kültür öğesine gelmiş bir oyun. Oyuncuların mutlaka oynaması ya da en azından bilmesi gereken bir oyun. Valve'ın en iyi oyunu. Gerçi sadece Valve'ın da değil çıktığı dönemde en iyi oyundu Half-Life. Hikayesi güzel görüntü kalitesi güzel hele hele multiplayer kısmı internet kafelerin vazgeçilmeziydi. Kendi çocukluğumdan hatırlıyorum da bizim internet kafede yer olmazdı sırf herkes oynayabilsin diye herkes en fazla 1 saat aralıksız oturabilirdi. Bir masa boşalınca kimin sırasıysa hemen o masaya geçer oyuna kaldığı yerden devam ederdi. Bomba kurmak, lazer veya süpürge... Bunların anlamları bizim için ayrı bir yer taşır. O dönemde olmayan şimdiki çocuklara üzülüyorum. Asla o internet kafe deneyimini yaşayamıyıcaklar. 

Ama oyun tabiki sadece multiplayer değil. Ne kadar en güzel kısmı o olsada tek kişilik oyuncu moduda gayet eğlenceli. Sessiz dostumuz Gordon Freeman'ın gözünden oynadığımız hikaye modunda yanlış giden bir deney sonrası farklı bir gezegen ile dünya arasında açılan geçitler sayesinde dünyanın uzaylı istalasına uğramasını anlatıyor. Tabi oyundaki tek zorluk uzaylılar değil. Oynanış yeni nesil oyuncuları biraz zorlayabilir. Çünkü yeni oyunların aksine burda şuraya git buraya git diye bir işaretçi yok. Ne yapacağınızı öğrenmek için dostlarınızı iyi dinlemeli ve ne dediklerine önem vermelisiniz aksi halde çoğu oyuncu gibi sağa sola boş boş koşup zaman kaybedersiniz. Ben dahil çoğu kişi dinlemediğimiz için aynı şeyleri yaşadık, aslında biraz da oyunun yapısıyla alakalı geliyor. Öyle bir oyun ki hani oturupta adamları dinleyesiniz gelmiyor yani. 

Neyse işin özü Half-Life bence artık oyun dünyası için genel kültür öğesidir. Oynamasanız bile bilin. Ama ben oynamanızı öneririm.Zaten Valve Complete veya Half-Life Complte alarak tüm seriyi çok uygun bir fiyata edinebilirsiniz. Kaldı ki bu fiyatlar bile indirime giriyor. 80SP

Good morning and welcome to the Black Mesa Transit System. This automated train is provided for the security and convenience of employees of the Black Mesa Research Facility personnel. Please feel free to move about the train or simply sit back and enjoy the ride.

The time is 8:47 AM. Current topside temperature is 93 degrees, with an estimated high of one hundred and five. The Black Mesa compound is maintained at a pleasant 68 degrees at all times.

This train is inbound from Level 3 dormitories to Sector C Test Labs and Control Facilities. If your intended destination is a high-security area beyond Sector C, you will need to return to the Central Transit hub in Area 9 and board a high-security train. If you have not yet submitted your identity to the retinal clearance system, you must report to Black Mesa Personnel for processing before you will be permitted into the high-security branch of the transit system.

Due to the high toxicity of material routinely handled in the Black Mesa compound, no smoking, eating, or drinking are permitted within the Black Mesa Transit System.

Please keep your limbs inside the train at all times. Do not attempt to open the doors until the train has come to a complete halt at the station platform. In the event of an emergency, passengers are to remain seated and await further instruction. If it is necessary to exit the train, disabled personnel should be evacuated first. Please stay away from electrified rails, and proceed to an emergency station until assistance arrives.

A reminder that the Black Mesa Hazard Course decathlon will commence this evening at nineteen hundred hours in the Level 3 facility. The semifinals for high-security personnel will be announced in a separate Secure Access transmission. Remember, more lives than your own may depend on your fitness.

Do you have a friend or relative who would make a valuable addition to the Black Mesa team? Immediate openings are available in the areas of Materials Handling and Low-Clearance Security. Please contact Black Mesa Personnel for further information. If you have an associate with a background in the areas of theoretical physics, biotechnology or other high-tech disciplines, please contact our Civilian Recruitment Division. The Black Mesa Research Facility is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

A reminder to all Black Mesa personnel: Regular radiation and biohazard screenings are a requirement of continued employment in the Black Mesa Research Facility. Missing a scheduled urinalysis or radiation check-up is grounds for immediate termination. If you feel you have been exposed to radioactive or other hazardous materials in the course of your duties, contact your Radiation Safety Officer immediately. Work safe, work smart. Your future depends on it.

its ok i guess

The best thing about Half Life is its atmosphere. It's been a long time since 1998 and it's fascinating to look at the game and compare what I see today to my childhood memories. It's the same graphics and gameplay, but somehow I'm more aware of how blocky everything is, and the way the textures are intentionally muddy, to imply what they represent instead of depicting it.

But what has stayed the same is the way the sounds and shadows sell you the idea of being trapped in a recently wrecked, top secret research center. It still evokes unease when you can expect terrifying, agile aliens ready to attack you in every corner you turn, and the unpredictable ways Black Mesa collapses on itself as you navigate its corridors. Everything about it exudes a subtle feeling of danger, with how it pits you against circumstances that keep you on your toes. If I pay too much attention to the pieces, it looks rough compared to modern graphical standards and game design. But the gestalt is perfect.

Half Life is a game that changed the first person shooter genre forever. It is a solid and entertaining sci-fi action game with excellent story telling embedded in the gameplay itself. I recommend it to people who enjoy first person shooters and puzzle solving, particularly to those who are fans of science fiction as well.

Чтоже, спустя 13 часов непрерывной боли, криков, стонов, быстрых сохранений и мольбы о медките я прошел первый half-life. Как можно было создать этот багованый неоптемизированный кускок треугольной текстуры никто не знает. Сюда я навряд ли вернусь в ближайший год... Вторая часть была на голову выше, ну и это понятно, новый движок, новые системы. Жаль только, что в вторую часть не добавили этого разнообразия оружия, что меркнет и становится бессмысленным против врагов(их разнообразие не уступает), про последнего босса я вообще молчу. Этого урода я проходил 3 ЧАСА, ТРИ ГРЕБАННЫХ ЧАСА БЕЗ ПЕРЕРЫВА, ЭТА Х*ЙНЯ ВООБЩЕ НЕ ДОХНЕТ, ЕЙ ПОХ*Й НА ВСЕ ТВОЕ ОРУЖИЕ, И ЕЙ ПОХ*Й, ЧТО ИЗ-ЗА ЕБ#НОЙ ЛОКАЦИИ У ТЕЬЯ ВСЕ 20 ХП ИЗ 100 НА МОМЕНТ НАЧАЛА БОССА, И ЕЙ ПОХ*Й, ЧТО У ТЕБЯ НЕТ ПАТРОНОВ, И ОНА БУДЕТ СПАУНИТЬ МОРЕ ВРАГОВ, ЧТО ВАНШОТЯТ ТЕБЯ, А САМ ЭТОТ ОГРОМНЫЙ ТРЕХРУКИЙ ПУПС, КРОМЕ ВАНШОТА УМЕЕТ ТЕБЯ ТЕЛЕПОРТИРОВАТЬ НЕДОПАРКУРУРОВНИ, ГДЕ ТОЖЕ ЕСТЬ МОРЕ ЭТИХ БЕСЯЩИХ ВРАГОВ... Я ВООБЩЕ МОЛЧУ ПРО ГРЕБАННЫХ СОЛДАТ, ОНИ НЕ УБИВАЕМЫ, А ТАНКИ, А ИНОПЛАНЕТЯНЕ-ТЯЖЕЛОВЕСЫ, А МАТЬ ЕГО ВЕРТОЛЕТ?!
А теперь из эмоций в рациональноость. Враги это правда отдельная тема, поначалу типов противников не так много и то оружие, что ты получаешь вначале более чем помагает, но тут на сцену выходят солдаты... Эти падла вообще не воспринимают урон(правда арболет ваншотит), ты можешь стоять в плотную к ним и стрелять им прямо в башку, но убьешь их только по истечению магазина, в то время, как они спокойно сидят себе на кортах(без преукрашевагия) и отстреливают тебе ноги, убирая примерно 40 ед хп... Инопланетяне-тяжеловики - это трехметровые хреновины в синей броне (Alien Grunt)(которая видимо им мала, ну вы посмотрите, как она сидит на нем) стреляющие из недотентакля самонаводящимися осами, их можно убить либо взрывом, либо двумя выстрелами из арбалета... В последней главе даже есть комнта наполненная большими вазами, которые если сломать, то появиться этот Инопланетянин-тяжеловик... Еще здесь есть враги, что появляются всего два раза игру, представьте, вы заходите в огромное помещение, похоже на заполненный контейнерами склад, и слышны только чьи-то шаги, и тут сзади в бочину ты ловишь 20-ти сантиметровый дротик и умираешь, так как в этой игре у тебя редко когда хп больше 30. Оказывается тут бегают тетки, забегают к тебе за спину и из-за угла сидя на кортах(тоже на полном серьезе) стреляют тебе в бочину из мини арболетиков. Как только ты направляешь на них оружие и стреляешь, то они по-быстрому сваливают... Про Огромного Трехрукого Пупса АКА Нихилант АКА самый сложный последний босс в моей жизни я сказал более чем достаточно выше.
Оружие, оружие, оружие... Его тут больше чем много, не всем я попользовался(до последнего босса). Тут есть пушки, которые ты получаешь, но забываешь о из существовании спустя минут 10. Например ультра пылесос. Вы думали, что ваш домашний пылесос от филипс крут и мощен? неееееееееет, он ничто по сравнению с этой турбовалыной. она способна убить все, что движется за пару секунд, но он разделяет боеприпасы с другой турбовалыной, что вы не будете много использовать, Автоматическая-трахалка-всея-мир. Два режима: обычный, слабый, никчемный выстрел и, если задержать, мощный супер выстрел превращающий даже Грантов в прах. Кроме подобной фигни, тут есть 4 вида гранат: обычные гранаты, С4, настенные мины и таракан. Если с первыми тремя все понятно, то тараканы умеют бегать и жрать врагов, а в конце их недолгой жизни взрываться, но если враги кончились, то они будут кушать тебя. И как же можно обойти стороной арболет? Это супер вещь в обоих частях халфы. Она ваншотит жалких смертных, а остальную живность убивает с двух точных попаданий.
При этом всем, игру не хочется бросить на половине, она притягивает к себе, ты не можешь оставить непройденными эти коридоры, нерешенными эти загадки, точно такое же было и во второй части, вот она магия халфы. А еще я научился прыгать как спидранеры: точно, четко, красиво - ибо физика позволяет, даже Black Mesa не заменит эти кривые прыжки на половину карты зацепляясь за пиксель выступающий и текстурки по случайности и застревание в текстурах на 20 секунд. Но этот кусок говна оставляет приятное послевкусье, отличная игра...











                                                                                                                       Если вдруг вы захотели пройти этот щедевр, будьте готовы к отсутствию патронов и медкитов, ибо в те времена казуальщиков не было, вспомните только игры на Денди...
ayuda ya no se que poner en las reseñas

Review nach 13,7 gespielten Stunden, Story durch. 

Puh, kein leichtes Unterfangen, ein zwanzig Jahre altes und dazu noch absolut in den Himmel gehyptes Spiel möglichst objektiv zu bewerten. Ein Großteil der Leute, die dieses Spiel in ihrer Steam-Bibliothek haben, schaut mit nostalgisch verklärtem Blick auf ihre Anfangszeiten zurück und sind natürlich hellauf von diesem Klassiker begeistert. Will ich auch nicht kritisieren, ist ganz normal. Entsprechend skeptisch ging ich dann selbst an Half-Life heran, kam in der Vergangenheit selbst nie damit in Berührung. Aber für gut einen Euro im Sale... was kann man da falsch machen? 

Um hier gleich das wichtigste vorwegzunehmen, Half-Life hat mich positiv überrascht. Trotz des absolut fortschrittlichen Alters läuft es erst mal rein technisch völlig flüssig, hier muss sich niemand Sorgen machen. Auch auf Windows 10 kein Problem, zumindest mit der Steam-Fassung. Die Steuerung fühlt sich auch nicht altbacken an, hier haben wir die gleichen Grundprinzipien, wie auch moderne Shooter. Wer mal Counter-Strike gespielt hat, wird in Sachen Steuerung kaum einen Unterschied bemerken. Dass die Grafik entsprechend aussieht, wie sie aussieht, nun, das ist natürlich selbstverständlich. Mag durchaus Spieler geben, die dieser Look abschreckt, vorrangig unter den Jüngeren. Als Minuspunkt kann ich das aber keinesfalls verbuchen, ganz im Gegenteil. Trotz der eingeschränkten Möglichkeiten in Sachen Grafik, schafft Valve es hier immer wieder eine erstaunliche Atmosphäre aufzubauen, gerade noch in Verbindung mit dem eingehenden Soundtrack. 

Die Atmosphäre ist überhaupt ganz allgemein ein wichtiger Punkt, steht hier doch die Einzelspielerkampagne im Fokus. Wie erwähnt wurde hier wunderbar mit den gegebenen Möglichkeiten der Technik gearbeitet und unser Protagonist findet sich in einer bedrückenden, schaurigen und zumindest was das Leveldesign angeht auch recht abwechslungsreichen Welt wieder. Obwohl man einen wesentlichen Teil des Gameplays unter der Erde verbringt, wurden dort ausreichend verschiedene Locations geschaffen. Und als es sich für mich dann doch anfing, etwas langzogen zu wirken, kam der komplette Szenenwechsel in der späteren Spielphase. Ein gewisser Horror-Aspekt kommt auch nicht zu kurz. Wer diese Welt zum ersten Mal betritt und grundsätzlich schreckhaft ist, wird hier öfters mal erleben, wie das eigene Stresslevel ordentlich nach oben geht. Als Horror-Spiel würde ich Half-Life trotzdem nicht beschreiben, dazu fehlt noch was.   

Als bestenfalls mittelmäßiger Shooter-Spieler entschied ich mich für den mittleren Schwierigkeitsgrad und war auch absolut glücklich damit. Am Anfang noch eher weniger fordernd, entwickelt sich der Schwierigkeitsgrad stetig weiter und gegen Ende des Spiels (und auch an vielen Situationen auf dem Weg dahin), war Half-Life eine ganz schön harte Nuss, die es zu knacken galt. Abgesehen von den Gegnern, stößt man hier auch regelmäßig auf zu lösende Rätsel, bei der Frage, wie man denn jetzt eigentlich weiterkommt. Ich muss gestehen, da bin ich das ein oder andere Mal schon nahe an meine Frustgrenze gekommen. Auch meine Wenigkeit ist da von moderneren Spielen vielleicht schon etwas verwöhnt worden, wo man immer sehr stark an der Hand genommen wird. Umso schöner dann, am Ende doch das nächste Level zu erreichen. 

Um ein Schlusswort abzugeben. Half-Life ist nach heutigen Maßstäben kein Meisterwerk. Aber auch heute noch ist es ein durch und durch solider Shooter, mit forderndem Gameplay und ordentlicher Atmosphäre. Ein gutes Spiel für wenig Geld. Obendrein darf man hier noch ein wenig historische Computerspielgeschichte miterleben, um beim nächsten Mal besser mitreden zu können ;-)

I played this for the first time 20 years after it's release, and it felt like a totally compent modern FPS, not because it's a copy of other FPSes, but because they are a copy of this. Obviously the only drawback is some technical limitations for the time like general graphics and audio quality. But if you can get past that it's really worth a play, even all this time later!

Söylenecek çok söz yok. Çıktığı zaman en iyisiydi. Oyun senaryosu ve akışı gayet güzel. Hep aynı tarz canavarlar can sıkıcı, buglar can sıkıcı bir halde ve yönlendirmeler çok eksik. Bazen oyunda amacımızın ne olduğunu anlamak için epey zaman harcıyoruz. Nereye gidiyoruz? Ne yapmalıyız vb... Uyarı veya hatırlatıcılar çok az.
Çıktığı zamanı düşününce bunlar hepsi unutulabilir. O yüzden çok keyifli bir oyun Half-Life. Özellikle arkadaşlarınızla oynuyorsanız son derece güzel zaman geçirebileceğiniz bir oyun.
The begining of the story "Where's Half-Life 3?" pitter patter get at her!

Bought it for 0.81€, took me almost 9 hours to finish the game. 
It's still a great game, after all those years, I really enjoyed it.
It's challenging, there are good puzzles etc.

The enemy is hard, they don't just stand there, waiting for you to shoot them, they will flank you, they throw grenades, hide, get in position, makes you feel like that they are really human being.
For 8.19€, it's worth it, but if you don't wanna spend that much, wait for a sell, and you can easily buy it.

Por donde empiezo, en su tiempo de lanzamiento marco un antes y un después en la industria del videojuego juego galornado y aunque no lo jugué en sus años de apogeo si no en 2012 y 6 años después que vuelvo a jugar en este año me sigue encantando le tengo mucho cariño a este juego fue uno de los primeros que jugue.

Si buscas una aventura de firts person shoteer este es tu juego no solo se trata de correr y disparar como en otros juegos ya que puedes afrentar en una historia increíble que hasta la fecha no ah sido acabada.
Sin mas te lo recomiendo jugar.
